pageContext.claim: “Media Falsely Claimed Violent Riots Were Peaceful And That Tear Gas Was Used Against Rioters”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is wrong. A largely peaceful protest had formed outside the White House, which was broken up using forceful measures including tear gas in order for the president to take a photo in front of St. John's Episcopal Church. The Park Service initially said no tear gas was used, but then a spokesman later said that was a mistake.
